intro: Eriocaulon rubescens, commonly known as the red-stemmed spikerush, is a flowering plant native to wetland environments in tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems that turn reddish in color as they mature. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are arranged in spikelets, typical of the Cyperaceae family. Eriocaulon rubescens often grows in shallow water or moist soil, contributing to the ecological diversity of wetland habitats.
